member.summary: A class to hold a 3-D Animation

member.name: T:PhilLibX.Animation.DataType
member.summary: Animation/Bone Data Types

member.name: F:PhilLibX.Animation.DataType.None
member.summary: Animation Data is same as other bones (for bones that will match the other bones)

member.summary: Animation Data is relative to zero

member.name: F:PhilLibX.Animation.DataType.Relative
member.summary: Animation Data is relative to parent bind pose

member.name: F:PhilLibX.Animation.DataType.Additive
member.summary: Animation Data is applied to existing animation data in the scene

member.name: T:PhilLibX.NativeMethods
member.summary: Description: Native/Unmanaged Methods (DLLs required for certain components)

member.name: F:PhilLibX.NativeMethods.OodleLibraryPath
member.summary: Oodle Library Path

member.name: M:PhilLibX.NativeMethods.ReadProcessMemory(System.Int32,System.Int64,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Reads data from an area of memory in a specified process. The entire area to be read must be accessible or the operation fails.
member.param: A handle to the process with memory that is being read. The handle must have PROCESS_VM_READ access to the process.

A pointer to the base address in the specified process from which to read. Before any data transfer occurs, the system verifies that all data in the base address and memory of the specified size is accessible for read access, and if it is not accessible the function fails.
A pointer to a buffer that receives the contents from the address space of the specified process.
The number of bytes to be read from the specified process.
A pointer to a variable that receives the number of bytes transferred into the specified buffer.

member.name: M:PhilLibX.NativeMethods.WriteProcessMemory(System.Int32,System.Int64,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Reads data from an area of memory in a specified process. The entire area to be read must be accessible or the operation fails.
member.param: A handle to the process with memory that is being read. The handle must have PROCESS_VM_READ access to the process.

A pointer to the base address in the specified process from which to read. Before any data transfer occurs, the system verifies that all data in the base address and memory of the specified size is accessible for read access, and if it is not accessible the function fails.
A pointer to a buffer that receives the contents from the address space of the specified process.
The number of bytes to be read from the specified process.
A pointer to a variable that receives the number of bytes transferred into the specified buffer.

member.name: M:PhilLibX.NativeMethods.OpenProcess(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Opens an existing local process object.
member.param: The access to the process object. This access right is checked against the security descriptor for the process. This parameter can be one or more of the process access rights. If the caller has enabled the SeDebugPrivilege privilege, the requested access is granted regardless of the contents of the security descriptor.
If this value is TRUE, processes created by this process will inherit the handle. Otherwise, the processes do not inherit this handle.
The identifier of the local process to be opened.
